Possible meanings: 1) Amaziah was the only priest at Bethel or 2) Amaziah was the leader of the priests at Bethel.

tn.ref: Amos has conspired against you in the middle of the house of Israel
tn.text: AT: "Amos is right here in the land of Israel, and he is planning to do bad things to you"

tn.ref: The land cannot bear all his words
tn.text: "The people might believe him and then do things that destroy the nation"
"see if you can get the people there to pay you for prophesying"
This here probably means "one who takes care of sheep" since he is called a "shepherd" in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:01:01|1:1]].
This expression stands here for any foreign land, where the people are not acceptable to God.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
